Class DateTools

extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for Date conversions.
    Version:

    Last modified by: $Author: ctipper $
    Last modified on: $Date: 2013-02-28 15:34:36 -0500 (Thu, 28 Feb 2013) $

      • getDate

                     java.lang.String timeZone)
        Try to create a Date object given a time string and a time zone.
        Parameters:
        timeString - string containing the time
        timeZone - the time zone
        Returns:
        a date object using the time string if possible, now otherwise

      • getDate

        Try to create a Date object given a time string and a time zone. Time zone defaults to null.
        Parameters:
        timeString - string containing the time
        Returns:
        a date object using the time string if possible, now otherwise

      • checkDate

        public static boolean checkDate(java.lang.String timeString,
                java.lang.String timeZone)
        Determines if the provided timeString and timeZone are of a valid Date format. Returns true if valid, false otherwise. Used by DatasetVerificationTool.
        Parameters:
        timeString - string of the time
        timeZone - string of the time zone.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • dateComparison

        public static int dateComparison(java.util.Date o1,
                 java.util.Date o2,
                 boolean ascFlag)
        Compare two Date objects, ignoring all but day, month and year information.
        Parameters:
        o1 - the first Date object
        o2 - the second Date object
        ascFlag - flag indicating sort direction, ascending or descending
        Returns:
        result the comparator value

      • dateComparison

        public static int dateComparison(java.util.Date o1,
                 java.util.Date o2,
                 boolean ascFlag,
                 boolean dateOnly)
        Compare two Date objects, with the option to use the date only, cropping hours, minutes and seconds off the Date before comparing.
        Parameters:
        o1 - the first Date object
        o2 - the second Date object
        ascFlag - flag indicating sort direction, ascending or descending
        dateOnly - flag indicating hours, minutes and seconds are ignored
        Returns:
        result the comparator value
